Hehe... Blowsuk.
Someone once offered me a Blowsuk in a bathroom, I'd have accepted if I knew it was a whole damn sub!
It was for safety reasons.
When has the Coalition ever given a rat's ass about safety? Let's be honest, they're just lining their pockets.
Whatever the case, I'm still following their tier suggestions.
Sure, I'll be honest. You're fucking retarded, there's my honesty.
They're keeping you safe...
If you want to pilot your own tier 1 sub through the hydrothermal wastes, knock yourself out...
Safety reasons?! An old Dugong with enough marks invested could make it all the way to the hydrothermal wastes!
Who in their right mind would pilot a Dugong to the hydrothermal wastes?
The key word there is could. Doesn't mean they did.
All the money you invested into it wasn't worth it. Buying a tier 2 or 3 sub now seems so much more cost effective.
Do you hear yourself right now?
Even the Separatists are following it now. Considering how much they hate the Coalition, I think that should speak for itself.
Grhh... you've got a fair point...
The Separatists are following it now? Seriously?
There goes my plans of siding with the Separatists.
Is that mold growing on the wall there?
Shit... ballast flora?!
I'd have noticed if it was ballast flora.
It's definitely not ballast flora.
I look pretty unroasted, so I'm sure it isn't ballast flora.
Trust me, if it was ballast flora, I'd know.
Ew. Someone get the sprayer.
Nose goes.
What the- hey! Fuck.
No way you just said that.
What's that mean?
It was an old Earth game for picking who did something.
You don't know? Well... I guess you're doing the sprayer job then.
What that mean?
It was an old Earth game for picking who did something.
You don't know? Well... I guess you're doing the sprayer job then.
I don't know if the sprayer gets rid of mold...
It's the sprayer. It gets rid of anything.
If you don't want to do it, you can just say so.
Time to find out.
Never know if you don't try.
It's an artistic garden decoration.
It's mold.
Respect the blessing of the gods or starve!
You have no eye for art.
A fool calls it mold, a genius calls it art.
The hell does that mean?
Someone put it in a planter box!
Of course you're the one to say something like that...
Probably an old vomit stain.
Either way, someone clean that up.
I honestly hope it's mold and not a vomit stain.
Both the Coalition and Separatists are starting to block off passageways to the deeper biomes...
Have you seen the rates they charge for crews who don't show loyalty?
They mask it with the cover of protecting us.
If they wanted to protect us, they wouldn't take bribes.
That mask isn't holding.
A dangerous lie to peddle with all that radiation.
I don't know a single soul who got fooled by that lie.
I have. It's not pretty.
We better pick one to curry favor with.
Money that could be better spent on our survival.
Funny how the Separatists preach freedom but do the same autocratic control...
When push comes to shove, they want crews like us to pick a side.
How about they both go fuck themselves?
We're siding with the Coalition, right?
Hey, let's vote third party! You know, with the church!
It's going to get real dicey out there soon, I'm sure of that.
Everything devolves into politics...
I doubt we have time to side with both of them. We better give our side some thought.
I really hate how intrusive this political war has gotten in our lives.
Another obstacle we'll have to barge through I suppose.
Can't exactly barge through those floating fortresses.
Yeah. We'll have to make do as we always do.
Here's to hoping.
I'm sure we can do it!
Think Ignatius and Victoria had something to do with it?
You bet your ass I do. Coalition and Separatists are probably logging who travels through their blockades right now.
Victoria probably copied Ignatius's homework if you ask me. Saw it working for the Coalition, took it as her own.
Probably. They're pretty important figureheads you know.
Ehh... seemed like a bureaucratic decision if you ask me.
I doubt it. They're too busy these days.
I understand the Coalition does everything better but... Jovian Force? I think it's better than Coalition Premium.
What the fuck are you saying?! Treason! Treason of the highest order!
I know, I know! The filthy dogs finally made something worthwhile!
Take that back! Take that back right now!
Impossible! Inconceivable!
No, no, NO! That is NOT possible! They're the Separatists, they are the enemy!
I thought you were loyal like me... but now I see the truth, you dirty sympathizer.
What did you just call me?
Quit fighting. We're on the same side.
Ladies, ladies. Shut the fuck up please. We're all busy doing our jobs.
Hey, hey! Don't fight!
Both of those are dirt cheap and taste like dirt too.
Yeah, says the guy who likes Ol' Cadmus.
You've never tried, have you?
There's a reason they're only around 10 marks.
It's a waste of money to buy alcohol.
Lighten up Mr. Serious. All of us need a break at some point.
Alcohol helps me break past the veil! Take it away and I'll take away your life...
Alcohol has more vital resources than water, Dr. Happy confirmed it!
A break, sure. Alcohol, no.
Alcohol hinders performance and efficiency during the rigors of a voyage. So I am on their side.
Yeah, being on this submarine is stressful.
Yes. Break very necessary.
Spoken like a true addict.
Watch your tongue.
I don't even drink that much.
Seriously? I'm not even close to being an addict.
But have you tried it?
Yes I have.
I doubt he's tried much of anything, man's so rigid he may as well be a fucking statue.
Of course I have. Many nights of drinking myself to sleep.
I don't waste money on it.
Bah, you see assistants drunk half the time they're on a sub anyway. Can't be any worse than they already are.
Not until they put on the clown suit.
I... shit.
I was talking in general, not about only assistants.
You underestimate them.
Haha, classic strawman.
Those are only on farms, numbskull.
Is that really a strawman though?
I didn't ask for your opinion.
I'm more of a Rum guy myself.
I don't think I'll ever go down to Rum. Not until it really gets sugarcane like it needs.
Rum is basically purified raptor bane, honestly. It's overpriced.
I never really liked Rum.
Rum is way too expensive.
They should outlaw gene splicing already. Taints our glorious bloodline.
Don't start another master race speech. It's really weird.
Am I wrong?
Look, just not right now.
I'm not going to comment, just drop the topic.
Well there is another race that ascends much higher...
I really do respect how driven you are man. I just hate your speeches.
Gene splicing is really helpful for surviving this place.
Right? Let me implant a few in you and you'll see.
You disrespect how our ancestors carved these icy rocks into a home from the teeth of threshers.
We didn't need that shit to survive when we first arrived and we damn well don't need it now.
They're right.
Well said.
Bah, you hardly find genetic material anywhere these days.
It's so weird wrecks hoarded the stuff. Maybe that's partly why they went down...
All the wrecks I see have a dead clown with a bomb somewhere.
How would that work though? Gene splicing induced madness? Doesn't make sense to me.
A positive boon for our genetic endeavors at minimum.
If you ask me, I think it mutates and grows in the wrecks themselves...
Seriously. We need a xenologist.
Not to mention how unstable the stuff is... I wouldn't want it going into my DNA, that's for sure.
I've been thinking. How many people die in the caves we explore? All the jagged parts are covered in blood.
Even in the cold caverns, those icy caves look like a slaughter happened.
You'd be surprised how many people risk their lives for minerals.
Maybe it's not blood. Those ice spikes could grow like that, I guess.
Drop this topic immediately. You're asking too many sensitive questions.
The Coalition is in on it...?!
Wait... what are you implying?
Uhh... okay.
Huh... never really thought about that. Now that you mention it, yeah, that's odd.
Is odd, yes. Perhaps full crew go mining and not return?
They're covered in my blood from when the damn currents push me into them.
We're never going to know, no point in dwelling on it.
You'd think if some poor people got impaled by them, we'd see their bodies or the things would break...
Crawlers probably got to them first.
You ever heard of the word decomposition?
It's a CONSPIRACY!
Not everything is a conspiracy.
Honestly? Maybe it is...
It's not a conspiracy.
Guess so.
The cave spikes are behind all our problems! Destroy all cave spikes!
Between you and me, the Coalition might be cleaning it all up.
Yeah. Pretty strange now that you mention it.
That's... not a topic I'd like to discuss.
Hah, pansy.
Yeah, you're right. Sorry.
I was just curious.
Alright. I understand.
I guess it is a pretty dark subject...
It is a refraction of us explorers, the rocks dotted with the lifeblood of Europa!
I'm not going out in a way like that.
English, please?
Guess so... it's just odd to me.
But... that many deaths to the same thing?
I think plenty of sailors are dumb but... surely not that many can be dumb.
The clowns were behind the Tormsdale incident, the Separatists and the Coalition are covering it up!
I genuinely think it was an accident. Their reactor was an old model from what I know.
Yes, the EF-03 Reactor was already massively out of date at the time.
Thanks for the backup, Egghead.
See what I mean?
Really? Gives them some plausible deniability then.
A reactor explosion doesn't kill only political opposition man.
What if the reactor was racist?
YES, THAT'S IT! THE REACTOR WAS RACIST!
Hey, if reactors can be racist, someone check ours.
Well if it was, sure. It wasn't though.
Then we'd be celebrating Jovian History Month.
That's what they want you to think!
I suppose they won then because it's what I'm thinking.
We can agree to disagree, we'll go nowhere with this argument anyway.
No conspiracy you spout will really convince me otherwise.
I read the report once. It was all preplanned.
There is no way in hell you read that report.
Nice try but that lie isn't fooling me.
No way...
I wouldn't put it past them.
As if the clowns could pull something like that.
Yes, see? You understand!
But what do they have to gain? Nothing, right? Seems pointless to me.
I would.
Indeed, but there is no substantial motive that could remotely tangentially tie the two together.
Tormsdale what now?
An incident that started the Coalition's rise to power. Huge explosion wiped out the Separatist's predecessors.
Seriously? Never heard about it.
Woah... convenient...
First time I'm hearing about that.
Is this another one of your crazy made-up stories?
It is NOT made-up, look into it!
Made-up?! No, NO! It is real and the clowns did it!
Sure sounds like it to me.
The Tormsdale incident never happened, it was all paid actors...
Hey, put some respect on the dead's grave.
Don't say that. That's messed up.
Hmm... now that's a good theory to look into...
What the fuck is wrong with you? They were real people who died!
Paid actors?! That's absurd!
Yeah. Which Tormsdale?
The one by... well, I don't remember actually.
It was one of them, that's as much as I know.
I don't know, it happened before I was born.
I couldn't tell you, the place was shut down after the incident.
I think it was in the Europan ridge... somewhere.
There's multiple...?
Why would the Coalition cover that up? They'd call out the clowns immediately.
Yeah, if I know anything about the Coalition, they'd rat that out instantly.
Mhm-hm. Doesn't make any sense if you think about it.
Right? I'm pretty sure we all know that fact.
Exactly. What you're saying makes no sense man.
We did it to prevent a witchhunt.
You're only saying that because you're a diehard loyalist.
That's not credible coming from you of all people.
Hah, as if you were ever high ranking enough to know the full report.
I'm sure it was an accident.
Whatever it was, the clowns sure as hell weren't behind it.
Accident, sabotage, either way the clowns didn't do anything.
Man, first time I'm about to defend the clowns but... yeah, I agree.
I don't think it was an accident per se but I don't think the clowns did it.
A pretty conveniently timed accident if you ask me...
Coalition blackmail clowns?
Clowns are a bunch of nutcases, they'd ignore any blackmail.
With what? I don't think anything is good enough to blackmail them with.
Ehh.. that seems pretty unlikely if you ask me.
It's an option but I don't think the Coalition would risk their reputation for some cheap blackmail.
Only proposing idea.
I haven't found a single artifact lying on the seafloor or in a cave anymore.
Damn pirates probably got to all of them.
Or the researchers did.
Either way, we're shit out of luck for finding them easily.
Whatever the case, they're only in those ruins now.
Me neither. Wonder what happened to them.
Teleported back to their containers or something...?
Snatched up by all the scientists I imagine.
No idea. Pretty big mystery if you ask me.
The crushing grip of the veil washed them away from us.
A horrific setback for research and development purposes and quota.
Scientists have a quota? Well I guess that's not too surprising.
Yeah. Bad for us to pawn off as well...
I don't think artifact research was going anywhere anyway honestly.
We've been here more than 50 years. I'm not surprised if all the easy to access ones have basically dried out.
Even the ones in places like the great sea though? Strikes me as a bit odd.
You know what? That's fair enough.
50 years in this hellhole... makes me sick just thinking about it.
A week ago I heard a strange story. A captain bought a submarine that was already infested with Ballast Flora!
That evokes some mysterious and puzzling insights...
How are these new submarines sourced that would allow such an infection to occur on shipment? Quite the mystery...
My guess is the captain just lied to make it seem like he didn't get the submarine infected himself.
Agreed. I wonder how it really happened...
Was it built in the ridge? That might explain it, ballast flora is pretty common there.
It was, actually. So maybe that's why.
No, constructed at a shipyard in the cold caverns. That's what makes me curious about the story.
Yes, this make perfect sense!
Oh yeah. I didn't even think about that, good point.
Weird... I thought they built all the things manually.
Me too... makes you think, doesn't it?
Yeah. Either he's lying or something's suspicious with their process.
The Coalition will reuse parts from wrecks but performs rigorous safety tests first. I imagine it was a shipyard procedure error.
Might be leftovers from a refurbished wreck.
I didn't even know they did that.
Eugh... so they're sailing in a coffin, gross.
Every submarine is a coffin, let's not kid ourselves here.
Yeah... hope ours wasn't built like that.
I hope there's no ghosts onboard...
That sounds way too time consuming though... but it does make some sense.
Who knows? Certainly not us.
It's the best explanation I've got.
Oh, maybe. Though that makes you think how it got past inspection.
Inspection? What inspection?
I doubt it even had an inspection.
Hah, you think they inspect that stuff?
Who knows.
Why the hell did the Coalition standardize all our equipment? I want fabricator class mechanics back!
Wanted to ship us out with less resources probably...
Bastards can't spare us a dime.
I'll bet you're right about that one.
Going to miss our free plastic.
All of the controlled outposts and still not enough to supply us with some variance.
*sigh* Me too.
We should start a petition or something. Reinstate the old job class system!
Me three.
It was a nice system while it lasted...
Ehh... we can agree to disagree, I thought the system was a waste of resources.
I don't know, I disliked the system. All the submariners I met used the same class each time.
Everyone using the most effective classes is a good thing for us.
No one was an admiral, everyone was a renegade.
You wanted variety instead of effectiveness? Are you dumb?
Yeah. I was never a big fan of it either.
Huh? What are you talking about?
We used to be able to pick a class of job we wanted. Admiral, Veteran, Renegade for captain... all of that stuff.
It was an old system the Coalition had in place to encourage sign-ups. It's not around anymore.
Basically, we used to get specific items depending on what class of the job we picked.
Logistics reasons. Not easy supplying all the people across Europa signing up for service with different gear.
All you normally do is speak propaganda... but I honestly believe your reasoning this time.
You know what? That actually makes sense.
All those years of power and yet we still can't spare a teensy ounce of plastic.
My shipment of ballast flora spores got impounded by Coalition customs.
That much ballast flora looks suspicious though, doesn't it?
Hold on, are you trying to make a bioweapon out of the gas?
What? Nooooo. Even the Europan advises against that.
...Security better be watching you.
Not good, bad! Very bad!
I don't trust you with ballast flora spores.
Good because this ship with ballast flora spores sounds like a nightmare.
Right, not good... it's actually great.
I only got two tiny bags handed back, the rest were refunded.
I'm surprised you even got a refund.
We will not be having ballast flora spores on this submarine at any point.
Not even for simple gardening pleasures?
Simple gardening does not require that many spores.
Grow tobacco instead. At least then we can make some money.
No. Too dangerous.
My shipment of ballast flora spores got impounded by Coalition customs.
That much ballast flora looks suspicious though, doesn't it?
Hold on, are you trying to make a bioweapon out of the gas?
What? Nooooo. Even the Europan advises against that.
...Security better be watching you.
Not good, bad! Very bad!
I don't trust you with ballast flora spores.
Good because this ship with ballast flora spores sounds like a nightmare.
Right, not good... it's actually great.
I only got two tiny bags handed back, the rest were refunded.
I'm surprised you even got a refund.
We will not be having ballast flora spores on this submarine at any point.
Not even for simple gardening pleasures?
Simple gardening does not require that many spores.
Grow tobacco instead. At least then we can make some money.
No. Too dangerous.
That ”Prophet of Sierpinsk” fellow. You think he's right?
Honestly? I do.
To each their own, he sounds like a crazy hobo to me.
Yes, of course he is correct. This is the way forward for all humankind.
They need to put you back in a mental hospital if you believe that bullshit.
Yeah, I think so too. Part of me is hoping he's wrong though.
It's the best lead we've got right now.
I'm really hoping he's wrong, it's a bad omen if he's right...
I wish we'd have something better by now. Maybe he's honestly right.
I'd like to avoid investigating it if I can help it.
We're going to the center no matter how we feel in the end. We've got no other option.
Get off this boat then, that's where we're headed.
The radiation is forcing us to the eye anyway. We'll find out if he's crazy or right soon enough.
If we're lucky he's crazy, not the other way around...
I'm not excited to find out the truth...
It must be hell down there... I don't know if we're cut out for it.
I don't know either.
I believe in us.
The Coalition did some research on it to my knowledge. I think they said he was most likely correct.
I'm not sure how I feel about that revelation...
I hope it's propaganda they're spreading again, honestly.
I have no idea who you're talking about to be honest.
Some guy saying all of Europa's gravity issues and shit are from the mysterious eye of Europa.
I'd buy that. The eye makes no sense even to the scientists.
I mean, we've proven most other things wrong so... he's probably right, yeah?
People really believe that? Bah, he's probably high on morphine.
That eye gets weirder and weirder the more I hear about it...
Me neither.
I don't know him that well, I only read about him on the Europan.
He talks about the mysterious eye of Europa and stuff. It's all really weird.
Guy's a real nutcase... but he might be a correct nutcase, to be honest.
Are any of you attending the Jupiter's Ascent parade this year?
Hell no.
Oh, absolutely!
Nah, they always change the location last minute.
I thought it was normally at Arid Troma?
That one is pretty bad, even Aunt Doris talked about how awful it was.
The big one is always changing locations, I mean.
It's like a national holiday, all the stations celebrate. The main one though, it always changes. I think it has something to do with money.
New Iapetus was the best one for sure.
I was there, that one was fun.
Oh yeah. I hope it's there this year, I might actually go if it is.
That was the one where I got my first taste of husk eggs!
I didn't get to attend that one sadly.
I'm busy. You know, being on this fucking submarine and all.
Good point.
I meant if we got some free time...
Yeah, I guess it's unlikely we'll make it now that I think about it.
I'd like to if I have the spare time.
Me too.
I really want some fried tiger thresher...
I hope they're not charging entry this year.
Triangle bought up the hydroponics farm near my homestation. Wonder what they're growing there...
God I fucking hope so. Anything to relax my nerves.
Isn't that stuff addictive?
So is morphine yet everyone shoots that up for injuries.
Fair enough.
Yeah, it's better than tobacco after all. I'll have some with you later if we can get our hands on it.
Weed flavored soda? That sounds horrible.
I know a guy who would love that, honestly.
Eugh. That's disgusting.
As long as it still keeps my mind off this shitty life.
Like... a weed in a garden?
No no, it's a thing you smoke like tobacco.
Err, no it's... nevermind.
It's this little plant you use to get a buzz like alcohol.
Probably some grapps or stewberries. Those exotic fruits from Earth.
Grapes and strawberries. They're spelt that way on the cans.
I wouldn't know, I've never had any of their drinks.
Was that how they spelt it back on the Earth?
Probably. I can't really be arsed to find out.
Yes, that's how it was spelt. I read up on ancient Earth resources in my spare moments.
I don't know. I'm just going to assume it is.
Even the words sound yummy.
How does a word sound yummy?
...Are you okay?
Strawberry. Mmmm.
I got a peek at their contract once. They basically just say ”Grow 50% of what you like, the rest is production for our brand.”
How'd you even see that?
I used to work as a farmer on a hydroponics farm.
Oh, cool.
Now you work on a much deadlier job, toiling the same sweat for double the risk.
Everything is being bought up these days... when's the last time you've really seen an independent outpost?
I mean, I've seen plenty of abandoned independent ones.
Those don't count.
I meant working ones.
The Coalition or Separatists basically rule every outpost.
I hear Triangle is some kind of... subsedary?
I don't buy that. They wouldn't be supplying the Separatists in that case or vice versa.
I thought that was some kind of medicine.
Humans rule every outpost, my friend.
Excluding the abandoned ones, I'm sure.
Well, I guess that's true.
More fruits for their soda operation I imagine.
They have too many flavors.
True, I doubt it's cost effective...
I like the variety.
Yeah, it was hard to pick one to start out with.
Do you think those fruits taste the same as the ones from Earth?
Who knows? I'll just assume they're the same thing until proven otherwise.
No. Corporations love to cut corners, I bet they're somehow artificial.
I'm not sure. I'd like to believe they are, a taste of the old ages right?
I'll ask my grandpa to taste test it. He was from Earth, I bet he'd know.
Mhm. Who knew Earth had such tasty stuff?
I hope it's that ”Pomegrenade Watermelon” flavor. That's delicious.
I bet it is. Growing watermelons must be easy with all the water on Europa.
Yeah. Maybe we should tie some of those watermelons to the outside of our submarine to grow.
Hey, that's a good idea. I like it.
Oh yeah, that's smart. We'll have to figure out where to tie them to though.
I wouldn't, it would probably attract all the creatures.
I've had enough pomegrenade ever since my old crew grew it everywhere.
When I was little my brother told me if I ate a pomegrenade without spitting out the seeds it would grow inside me. That's why I only drink pomegrenade extract.
Damn, really? I should check in with a doctor...
Hate to break it to you but your brother was full of shit. I don't have a pomegrenade growing inside me.
But... just spit out the seeds then?
I didn't want to risk it.
Too dangerous, what if I accidentally swallowed one?
To be honest I didn't like how they tasted either. The extract was good though, even better with that watermelon flavor.
Have you tried a mutated one? It's honestly a nice flavor.
Plenty. I'm sick of pomegrenades of all shapes and sizes.
The one time I tried one it blew up in my hand.
If they use watermelons, what do you think a regular melon looks like?
I think that's just the name of it.
What? That doesn't make sense, it doesn't look anything like water.
Well, it's only what I've heard. I don't think it makes much sense either.
I think it's because it has a lot of water in it.
You know, I never finished university. I thought a submarine would be the fastest way to learn.
Since when did crewmembers need university training?
Since never. It would be helpful to be mandatory though.
I only thought about it for a bit, ended up not going through with it.
Right? Half the seamen I see are dumb as bricks.
Not like there's any real schools on this moon anyway.
Fair point.
I learnt my talent in a back room on an outpost.
There's that one university at New Iapetus.
Yeah but that's the Coalition's capital. You can't be too surprised one got built there.
That's a Coalition military school, not a university.
Might be the first one on this whole fucking moon...
Me personally, I read a book on repairs.
How much did your university stint run you for?
Don't ask. Seriously.
I'm still paying off loans...
I dropped out when I saw the cost, so nothing.
I got a Separatist scholarship but my benefactors were assassinated by the Coalition a week later.
Experience is the best mentor, not a blackboard.
Well said.
If you don't wind up a corpse that is...
Hey, I like that saying. I think I'll steal that one.
That explains a lot.
Shut up.
I don't see you bragging about a university degree.
Yeah, like you made it through university yourself... hah!
Watch your tongue, you might become a workplace accident real soon...
They should really make some kind of anti fatigue food for submariners.
They did already, it's called coffee.
I think you mean Rumkaffee. Real coffee beans are basically ungrowable here.
Rumkaffee and coffee are different. I have had coffee before.
No, they're two separate things that happen to sound the same.
Rumkaffee is the cheap stuff, coffee is the expensive stuff.
Yes, but they are grown in a few specific hydroponics farms.
Fair enough.
Coffee isn't distributed to crews though.
That's what you wanted? That's never happening.
Hmm... that's a good idea.
Because it's expensive, that's why.
I'll settle for cheap energy drinks that don't kill my wallet, thanks.
They could. If they did though, I bet we wouldn't be able to afford it.
Mmm... you sure though? I think we could spare the marks.
Whose we?
I don't think we should waste our money on frivolous luxuries.
You'd have to take it up with the captain.
I bet they'd taste like shit even if we paid up anyway.
It would become some luxury class item like moloch bone.
I still don't believe molochs have bones, I've never seen one.
That's because you're broke.
You are too asshole.
Doesn't change the fact you still are.
Fair enough.
All of us are broke, let's not beat around the bush here.
Got me there...
Touche I suppose.
A moloch or moloch bone?
Bone, obviously. I've seen a moloch.
Moloch bone, that's what I meant.
Haven't seen much of either, really.
I saw a moloch picture at an outpost once if that counts.
Moloch bones are actually carved human bones.
Who the hell would take that job to carve up human bone?
Ew... I know it's some crazed theory but that's gross.
They are pretty thin, actually...
Moloch bones aren't carved human bones because molochs DON'T HAVE BONES.
Yeah, for sure. Probably out of reach for us.
With enough hard work, I think we could manage.
Glad to hear someone's realistic on this boat.
I'll keep my hopes up, for now anyway.
Wake me up when I'm an Azimuth captain...
Dream on pal.
That's a nightmare, mate.
Me too, me too...
I'd hate to pilot one of those fancy retirement homes on rudders.
The Coalition will provide for us if we only show our loyalty.
How delusional.
They barely funded us starting on this sub as is.
Don't get your hopes up, at best they'll give us a coupon for 10% off a shipment of whatever anti fatigue food they make.
I don't know about that one...
So do your best to serve them well.
I don't want people to have an excuse to overwork me even more.
Right? I've already come to terms with the fact I'm not retiring.
Don't remind me...
*sigh* Yeah.
Maybe not you but I sure as hell will.
Do I really overwork you?
Sometimes, but you're a good captain. I can handle it.
My old crews did, that's what I meant.
Only occasionally but it's fine.
I mean, it feels that way sometimes. I don't know if you really do though.
Hell yeah you do.
Work work work. Sleep not and repair junction box endlessly.
Sounds exactly like my work schedule.
What's that one saying... all work, no gay?
I thought it was all work, no pay.
Oh, that sounds accurate too.
Nah, that wasn't it... I can't remember what it was though.
All work, no pay... hmm... yeah, that was probably it.
All work, no play.
Yeah, that. I can't remember my last bout of free time that wasn't on an outpost.
Exactly! That's what I was thinking of.
I don't know, I play with the monsters in the water quite often...
I think that was it.
Asshole thing to say, ain't it?
Yeah. What a rude saying.
No, I'm misremembering. All work, no gay doesn't make any sense...
Tell me about it buddy. This shoddy submarine's going to fall apart one day.
Is already.
One day? It already is now.
I lace my charcoal tablets with ethanol sometimes. Gives it enough of a punch.
That sounds dangerous...!
It probably is, couldn't care less though.
It's just ethanol. Worst that'll happen is I get drunk.
So is everything on Europa. Doesn't make any difference to me.
They're right, it is detrimental to their health.
You know what else is? Being sleepy and making a mistake.
Dying is pretty detrimental too. I think I'll take the tablets over getting myself killed from a lack of focus.
Shit, is it actually? Guess I have to find some alternatives...
That's a shame. A shame I don't care.
I might have to start doing that with mine.
Getting drunk on those charcoal tablets... that sounds sad.
I don't get drunk off them.
You'd have to take a ton of the laced ones to get drunk, it's just not happening.
Don't patronize me.
Ew, that sounds disgusting.
Those tablets already taste like crap, I can't imagine adding ethanol on top of it.
It is. Gives me a nice kick in the ass to get going though.
Getting the resources for that kind of thing would be a real challenge though, no?
Couldn't be harder than growing tobacco in hydroponics.
You'd be surprised...
It would be much harder, tobacco is one ingredient, that food would probably take multiple.
Well, maybe so...
Honestly the tobacco option sounds easier to me. Just my input though.
It would take a lot of time for it to start getting to a steady production rate.
Time we don't have with the radiation.
I can wait.
I'm thinking about the next generation. It'll be good for them.
If we can rip out elastin plants from deadly caves I think growing coffee is a breeze.
Wait, coffee? I thought we were talking some hypothetical super anti fatigue food.
In that case it would work, I know some outposts already grow coffee beans.
I guess I should have clarified, my bad.
You're fine. I agree with you though.
Probably but whatever. Growing coffee doesn't sound too hard to me.
No no, I just thought coffee was a good example.
It's a good example. I agree with you in that case.
I really do wish they'd distribute coffee to us...
The caving part is the hard part, not really the ripping out elastin part. Like how farming coffee would be easy, distributing it to all the submariners would be hard.
That's... a good point, honestly.
I still think it could be done. Surely the Coalition has that kind of power.
Yes, logistically it would be a profound struggle, perhaps more so than our clashes with the lethal fauna.
I not feel sleepy. Do you?
Now that you mention it, I never really do get tired...
Not right now, no.
I sleep on 3 hours a day, I've started conditioning my body to that.
I always do, I never get a good night's sleep. If I sleep at all.
Perhaps this is the mission our fabled ascension takes place.
Someone crash this fucking ship before that happens.
I pray it is so.
Don't they teach you cultists not to do that shit early?
Or perhaps, it will be my quest for another time?
I'm hoping it's not.
99 bottles of beer on the wall, 99 bottles of beer...
Don't start singing that crap again, I almost went insane last time.
Is it that time of the month for you already?
You're a real downer.
Some of the others sure enjoyed it...
Uhhh... sorry.
Sheesh, lay off. You can just ask me to stop.
I wonder if we'll hit 0 before this mission is over...
Hope so. The less time spent here the better.
I'll probably strangle them before they hit 0 if they keep this shit up.
Time to find out.
This journey certainly isn't going to be a walk in the park.
The hell's a park..?
Man, that's an old saying.
Oh, I know this one! Take one down and pass it around, now there's 98 bottles of beer!
Hey, there you go!
I'm glad someone gets it!
Don't join them, please.
No singing on this boat, this isn't a christmas carol.
Please don't do that the whole way.
Sorry. Guess that's annoying, huh?
Have to pass the time somehow...
I agree. Clear comms, please.
I'll keep it brief then.
God, I'd kill for some beer right now. Maybe some Coalition Premium.
You do you. I'll stick with Jovian Force.
I won't buy you jokers a round unless you really buck up and help this ship.
Try not to fuck yourselves up too bad this time around.
Yeah, thanks Dr. House.
Is that Dr. Happy's cousin or something?
Dr. House actually gave a shit about his patients under all that rough skin.
No guarantees...
Europa and injuries are two sides of the same coin.
Ugh, this better be over quick...
If you really need it I'm here. Just try to avoid getting hurt first.
I'm only hoping one of us aren't dead by the end of this.
You've got enough supplies to handle it.
Doesn't mean I enjoy wasting them on shit that can be avoided.
We don't need all this medicine for simple cuts and scratches. Tough it out.
Do your job properly or you'll be turnt into a blood bag after this mission.
Jesus, I get it.
Oh fuck off.
Alright, alright...
Standard positions everyone, fall in.
On it.
Yeah yeah, I know...
Another shift, another stitch...
Good luck guys.
This mission better not be as boring as the last one.
Frankly I'm hoping it's boring.
Boring good, boring is survival.
You really called that last one boring? High standards...
I'd be counting my blessings if I were you.
Everytime it's smooth sailing I feel a year get readded to my life.
B-be extra careful this trip, captain!
I know, don't worry about it.
I'm always extra careful.
You've got it.
Prepare for a long journey today. We might be stopping for mining on this trip.
Alright guys, let's see who pulls the away team short stick...
For real? I was hoping this one would be done quick...
Better be some uranium or thorium out there.
Does this include gathering plants?
Mining always includes plant gathering if we can help it.
Yeah, ease up doc.
Keyword there is might, don't bet on anything.
Could always use some more fabrication materials back here.
Every journey through this ocean feels like centuries. *sigh*
Rags or riches, someone call the coin toss.
I don't believe it in that nonsense.
Just call it.
Way to kill the mood.
It best be riches or you'll be getting a pay cut.
You barely pay me anyway.
Lady luck, don't fail me now...
This expedition will surely expedite our forward march into the great core of Europa.
Indeed, indeed!
The core is poison and we are the cure.
I hope we stay far away from the core, I've heard bad rumors about that place.
We're here to make a buck, not do the work of the eggheads.
The radiation's got a thing or two to say about that one, cap.
There's a real thinker.
I doubt half of us could even find the core on a map.
Wait! What was that sound?! Did the outpost engineers sabotage us before we left?
Cut the paranoia.
I fucking hope so.
Doubt they could make anything break more than it already does.
The lights are flickering... IT'S A GHOST! A GHOST WAS PLANTED ON OUR SHIP!
A ghost? Haha, as if man.
The lights always do that.
I hope we get paid for transporting Casper to the next outpost.
Break's over crew, back to sailing.
Was just starting to kick back too...
Here we go again.
Got it, sir.
Aye aye.
I've got a good feeling this time around!
I hope that bodes well for us.
Good to hear.
Me too.
Eh, you've got a good feeling for everything.
Come over for your wellness check everyone. Forgot to do it at the last outpost.
Don't stick any weird needles in me without telling me what they are.
Busy with fabrication and deconstruction. I'll be over after this.
I am NOT coming over there! Last time you removed my glorious Husk, you cursed vermin!
I'll go first.
Make it quick, everyone has places to be.
I'll keep an eye on the doc if any of you are worried about that kind of medicine.
Reactor's in working order. We're good to go captain.
Thank you. Everyone, we're heading out!
Hope this goes better than last time.
No problem captain.
Here's to smooth sailing.
Are you sure...? It's making very loud buzzing noises.
That's normal, don't worry.
Uranium will do that.
Bah, it's nothing. Damn thing is a bit old is all.
I appreciate the diligence.
Don't sweat it. I wouldn't half-ass it.
No problem captain.
Pay me back by letting me park us this time.
Heh, maybe in a few years.
Don't go overreaching there.
I better see some ID, haha.
Check your stations, don't want any problems on the ride forward.
Pumps are in good shape! I doubt they'll break early on us.
Reactor is buzzing a bit loud this time. Shouldn't be an issue though.
The guns feel good and the periscope's firm as steel.
I'll see to it, captain.
Well isn't this a cute little place.
I've seen much better.
Right? So quaint.
Yeah! Let's see what they have for us!
Not nearly enough Coalition posters or insignia for my tastes.
Hmm... not bad.
I'm actually a bit impressed. Until I inevitably find the dark, drab cultist room that is.
Yes... it's too not bad. Something is fishy about this station, perhaps it's a human meat factory?
As always, human design radiates strength and effectiveness.
At least this outpost doesn't have bandits trying to chop my legs off.
I wouldn't be too certain yet.
Haha, that's just what they want us to think.
Now you'll have them chopped off by the crawler in the back room.
Think we can splurge a bit here, captain?
We'll see what they're offering.
Spend your own money.
Hmm.. depends on what's on sale...
Pick me up some crafting materials if you can.
Remember to stock up on more medicine!
Don't forget to buy more fuel rods this time.
Alright crew, stretch your legs a bit. We'll get going later.
Whew, that last mission was a long one.
I'm so glad we made it... I thought we were goners back there.
Don't forget to shut off the reactor.
Ahhh. Always happy to have a break.
Feels good not standing at the periscope all trip.
Alright, join me in a circle everyone. Let's see how many poker hands we can play before we've got to go.
Stock up, an undersupplied submarine is a dead one.
Where's the confetti cannon at the entrance? Tsk, low class station...
That clown station was really not that impressive. I kept slipping on fucking banana peels.
That sounds way too dangerous.
Do they even make confetti anymore?
Hope the folks here sell some ammo. We're gonna need it.
I'll look over how much we've got.
I dunno, I feel like we've got enough...
Yeah. Here's to hoping.
Time to see if anyone wants a job, eh?
I'll be on the submarine if you need me.
Don't feel like going in this time.
You're not going in? Alright then.
I need a break from outpost dwellers.
Who's going to be the one to rummage through the trash cans?
Oh no, don't go looking at me.
I'll do it if no one else will.
Whoever does it, I hope you find some morphine this time instead of lowsy wrenches.
Rock paper scissors to see who does it?
Let's pull sticks.
Whew, nice to be back on solid non-submarine ground.
Hope these people aren't as rude as the last ones.
Yeah, seriously.
I didn't think they were that bad.
I had a good time, sorry to hear you didn't.
Only the chief mechanic was a prick.
Let's see if we can get a few upgrades here...
I'm thinking hull upgrades. Can't go wrong with that.
My vote is for engine upgrades, faster we are the less monsters get to us.
Gun upgrades are my call, you can never have too much firepower.
Junction boxes have been all wonky lately, I say we invest in that.
Hey, have we got anything to sell here?
I'll check real fast.
Look at their prices before we go selling anything.
I'll take a peek.
Good way to earn a few extra marks.
None of you better try sneaking off with an item again, you'll have to answer to outpost security and me.
Are the algae protein cakes complimentary or paid here?
I haven't seen any outpost that has them complimentary.
They're definitely paid.
Don't ask me, ask one of the outpost dwellers.
I can't believe you're even settling to eat those.
Outpost manager then out, I don't want to stay here long.
Not your call to make.
Have some patience, jeez.
I'm not skipping on a resupply run.
I wonder what culture this station follows?
Just ask the thalami vs thalamuses question if you want to find out.
Guess we're about to find out.
I was raised as a south sea myself.
No kidding? Me too.
Really? Thought you were a northerner.
I don't recall asking.
This place could really use more color than drab greys.
Did you see what we just stepped out of?
Fair enough, the submarine isn't too colorful either...
Easier complained than done.
I think a splash of Coalition blue would do nicely.
That's what you think? No surprises there...
I see enough outposts with blue lines.
Of course you do.
I'm more partial to Separatist yellow or orange.
Good idea, maybe paint the halls with husk green?
Ignoring the husk part, I think green wouldn't go well with the grey.
Don't taint this outpost with your abhorrent philosophy.
No thanks.
Or ballast flora green.
Pink floors... with glitter... and a smiley face!
That sounds really tacky.
Interesting design choice...
What is this, a cartoon?
I'd like some splotches of purple. I hear that was the color of royalty back on Earth.
Purple? Royalty? Weird...
This outpost, royalty? ...Really?
If that's the case, I don't think it would fit.
Ooh, purple's a nice color.
